byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, Oleg Matsnev from Moscow and Falih Hassan from Baghdad.

abstract: Russia announces deal in which Syrian rebel fighters agree to turn over their territory within Aleppo to Syrian government, ending four-year battle over nation's largest city; deal, if carried out, would mark major turning point in Syria's nearly six-year war; news comes as United Nations reports scores of civilians were killed while pro-government forces were moving in.

headline.print_headline: Fight for Aleppo Ends With Defeat for Syria Rebels
headline.main: Battle Over Aleppo Is Over, Russia Says, as Evacuation Deal Reached

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: After a four-year battle, the last rebel fighters agreed to turn over their territory. The United Nations reported that scores were killed as pro-government forces moved in....
lead_paragraph: After a four-year battle, the last rebel fighters agreed to turn over their territory. The United Nations reported that scores were killed as pro-government forces moved in.
